p: Humulus lupulus L. (hops) flowers are used to preserve and give flavor to beer, while hops leaves are usually discarded as a waste. However, hops leaves contain Î²-caryophyllene, phytol, fatty acids, terpenes, and C 5-ring bitter compounds, and the oil obtained from the leaves contains bitter acids, in particular cohumulinic, dehydrocohumulinic, and humulinic acid, possessing antibacterial activity [ 155].
